channel.title: How far can Jagex go to shut you down?
channel.description:
After reading a post and http://www.moparisthebest.com/lawstuff I was curious as to EXACTLY what you can/cant have on your website and/or server for Fagex, sorry, Jagex to sue you and hijack your domain and shutdown your server?
I would like to hear someone who has extensive knowledge on this so if this should ever happen to me I know the steps to take in order to ensure my safety.

item.title: How far can Jagex go to shut you down?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:9, topic:452926”][quote author=t4 link=topic=555787.msg4069218#msg4069218 date=1344203778]
for starters, don’t ask for legal advice from people who aren’t lawyers - especially those who are 12 - 14 years of age!
[/quote]

I don’t know… when I see my brothers arguing, they end up solving the problem politically every time. You need the little people, it’s what gets you past the bigger people.[/quote]
is this a joke?

Read full topic
item.source: How far can Jagex go to shut you down?

I don’t know… when I see my brothers arguing, they end up solving the problem politically every time. You need the little people, it’s what gets you past the bigger people.[/quote]

item.title: How far can Jagex go to shut you down?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

What you can have: information, how-to guides, anything that isn’t copyrighted by Jagex.

What you can’t have: anything that is copyrighted from Jagex. Macros/cheats/bots may also apply, see rsbot and ibot for examples.

The issue with hosting servers/bots/whatever is when you receive revenue from it. Advertisements, donations, paid applications all count as revenue and the legal side can get pretty messy pretty quickly. You want solid legal advise? Go to a pissing lawyer.

Read full topic
item.source: How far can Jagex go to shut you down?
